column2: Investigate multi-threaded speculation of alternative paths of execution in a sequential execution
Provided support and testing for alpha testing of CentOS Linux distribution on POWER architecture

column1: Diffusion magnetic resonance imaging of human brain
column2: Drive diffusion basis spectrum imaging (DBSI) for clinical applications and large scale trials for a diffusion MRI modality which can increase the magnetic resonance imaging specificity for neurodegeneration diseases

A modern C++ toolkit containing machine learning algorithms and tools for creating complex software in C++ to solve real world problems. The projects ran tests and benchmarked PowerPC8 VSX optimizations.
Powered the testing and review of code contribution for Drupal 8 (qa.drupal.org)
Contributed to improving support of various open source projects in the GCC family on POWER machines; began by tackling IBM Linux Technology Center items on bountysource.com
Worked on adding `fast tracepoint support`_ for ppc/ppc64/ppc64le

A software package for analysis of high-throughput sequencing data with a primary focus on variant discovery and genotyping as well as strong emphasis on data quality assurance, hosted on POWER architecture to run faster
GNU C Library: GNU project's implementation of the C standard library; supported the development and testing on the POWER platform
Entailed the compilation of gmp-6.1.0 (from gmplib.org) and measurement of its performance with gmpbench-0.2 on the POWER platform
The International Components for Unicode project runs their build machines on a OSL hosted POWER VM

Supports the platforms that the mainstream node.js does not; IBM has a PPC version of V8; Besides V8, JXcore also implements SpiderMonkey engine; project involved providing stable PPC releases on each version of Node.JS / JXcore
Use GCC PowerPC altivec instructions to optimize the x265 open source HEVC implemenation
Involved testing on POWER8, provide fixes to platform specific bugs and make more stable on POWER8
Provide support on RHEL 7.1 LE & Ubuntu 14.04 on ppc64le arch
Provided hosting to support the development on the POWER platform of a high quality, portable, standalone C mathematical library (libm), used by the `Julia project`_
Used POWER infrastructure to demo OpenShift Origin clusters at KubeCon 2017
Added support for POWER hosts for a virtual machine manager

A plugin-based abstraction library for general purpose data compression algorithms which provides a common API for a large number of compression libraries, allowing people to easily test multiple codecs to see which works best, or pass along the choice to their users; it involved development and testing on the POWER platform and adding support for the big-endian architecture
